prime_awardee_business_types: Minority Owned Business,Self Certified Small Disadvantaged Business,For Profit Organization,Joint Venture Women-Owned Small Business,Economically Disadvantaged Joint Venture Women-Owned Small Business,Economically Disadvantaged Women-Owned Small Business,Woman Owned Small Business,Woman Owned Business,Limited Liability Company,Hispanic American Owned
subaward_description: THE OVERALL PURPOSE OF THE SUBCONTRACT SC-GSV-LEAP-001-24-AMPHEALTH IS TO PROVIDE LONG-TERM, SUSTAINABLE MENTORING AND CAPACITY BUILDING FOR THE CENTRAL AFRICAN REPUBLIC'S NATIONAL TUBERCULOSIS PROGRAM (NTP) TEAM. THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE THE EFFECTIVE MANAGEMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION OF PROGRAMMATIC FUNDS AND GRANTS, IMPROVED STAFF AND INTERNAL OPERATIONS MANAGEMENT, ENHANCED EXTERNAL RELATIONSHIPS, AND STRATEGIC USE OF DATA FOR PLANNING AND MANAGEMENT. KEY DELIVERABLES INCLUDE BI-MONTHLY CAPACITY BUILDING REPORTS, EXECUTIVE COACHING SESSION REPORTS, LEADERSHIP AND MANAGEMENT WORKING SESSIONS, MEL SURVEY REPORTS, AND THE DEVELOPMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION OF A SUSTAINABILITY PLAN TO ENSURE THE CONTINUITY AND INSTITUTIONALIZATION OF THE IMPROVEMENTS MADE. THE PERFORMANCE PERIOD IS FROM APRIL 1, 2024, TO SEPTEMBER 30, 2024.
